entry.title: Sorbonne University
entry.content:
Created by the merger between highly reputable universities UPMC and Paris Sorbonne, Sorbonne University is one of the biggest Parisian universities, with more than 55,000 students on its various campuses. The University offers several courses in computer science, in French or in English, for long or short periods.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ School Name Sorbonne UniversitÃ©
ğŸŒ Location Paris, France
âš–ï¸ Type Public University
ğŸ“† Course Duration 3 to 8 years
ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Erasmus Students Accepted
ğŸ’µ Price â‰ˆ 100â‚¬ (licence) to 601â‚¬/year (engineering master)

Present in the top 50 of the Worldâ€™s Top Universities according to the 2019 Shanghai University Rankings, The Sorbonne University is also one of the most important scientific hubs in Paris with very important research structures : 136 research units including 66 of the Faculty of Science & Engineering.

Sorbonne Universityâ€™s most important resource is it community of men and women who contribute to its missions through the diversity of their fields, the research they do and their personal and professional fulfillment.
â€“ Ambassadors of Sorbonne University

Students from all over the world come to Sorbonne University. They do this through Erasmus programs, international agreements, or by just applying directly for one of the degree programs. As this blog is dedicated to Computer Science and IT, you can discover the other courses offered by the University on their website.

A hub with scientific programs

Three choices of studies are offered by Sorbonne University : A 3-year bachelor, a 2-year master and a 3-year doctorate (with special arrangements for medicine courses). Within the programs, you have the choice between different major and minor to be specialized.

Here are some of the IT programs you can find at Sorbonne University :

  • Bachelorâ€™s in Computer Science (French)
  • Masterâ€™s in Computer Science (English)
  • Masterâ€™s in Engineering Sciences (English)
  • Engineering Degree or DiplÃ´me dâ€™ingÃ©nieur (French and English)

Regarding the Engineering Degree, the courses take place in Polytech, a French engineering school. Polytech delivers an engineering degree (equivalent to Masterâ€™s) accredited by the French commission of the title of engineer (CTI).

During your studies, you will work on areas such as robotics (ANDROIDE), software (STL), bioinformatics (BIM), imaging (IMA), computer networks (RES) and cyber-security (SAR, SESI and SFPN). Some international programs like the Masterâ€™s in Computer Science propose a double European master in English with a major in Computer science and a minor in Innovation (Cloud and Networks Infrastructure).

If you are looking for short studies, Sorbonne Universityâ€™s Faculty of Science organizes several international summer schools that are open to international students too.

A huge campus in the heart of Paris

The first time I went to the Sorbonne Universityâ€™s main HQ (called Jussieu) was a few years ago. At that time, they had just finished major renovations in this huge campus, a few meters from the Seine and in the heart of Paris. This contemporary campus is home to several thousand students, with public transportation nearby (bus and metro) and a large library inside the buildings.

The University also offers solutions for housing, such as financial assistance based on your income, or residences student. You will also find health services, restaurants and cafeteria. The Jussieu campus is located in the very chic 5th arrondissement of Paris, not far from Saint-Germain, the Marais or the Natural History Museum. As for the other schools or universities presented here, you will find many clubs or student associations to share your passion during your free hours.

ğŸŒ International Relation Service ğŸŒ
International Relations Department
relations.internationales@upmc.fr
entry.summary: Created by the merger between highly reputable universities UPMC and Paris Sorbonne, Sorbonne University is one of the biggest Parisian universities, with more than 55,000 students on its various campuses. The University offers several courses in computer science, in French or in English, for long or short periods.

entry.title: La Ruche
entry.content:
La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different â€œhivesâ€.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ Incubator Name La Ruche
ğŸŒ Location Paris - Saint-Germain-en-Laye, France
ğŸ° Size 3200 m2
ğŸ”¢ Startups incubated 125 projects per year
ğŸ› The â€œPetit plusâ€ La Ruche offers an incubation program for women in tech,
called â€œLes Audacieusesâ€ and member of the Tech for Good project
ğŸ’µ Price Starting at 145â‚¬/month

Launched 11 ago with the conviction that a responsible and collaborative society was possible, La Ruche offers a range of services for entrepreneurs and young startups, from incubation to growth through advice and co-working spaces in all France.

â€œThe Place to Beeâ€

From hackatons to half-day to several days trainings, La Ruche offers a range of support for entrepreneurs and startups. In 1 year, more than 125 projects were incubated with an 83% survival rate of incubated entrepreneurs in the first 3 years.

Regarding the workspaces, I will focus on HQs in Ãle-de-France and Paris Region, but La Ruche also has workspaces in Bordeaux, Marseille, Saint-Nazaire, Montpellier and more.

With 3200mÂ² dedicated to the positive economy and a terrace of more than 200mÂ² in Paris, La Ruche welcomes project leaders driven by social entrepreneurship, digital technology and culture. You find an astonishing diversity among co-workers, such as entrepreneurs, associations, employees, teleworkers, self-employed and intrapreneurs. Each category has its own tariff range adapted to its needs.

Programs for all

La Ruche offers special rates for everyone, and offers 5 programs :

  • Closed offices (starting 1kâ‚¬/month) with offices for up to 20 people, with a commitment of 6 months and unlimited access.
  • Full time program (starting at 350â‚¬/month) with unlimited access, a fixed office for 1 person and a 3-month commitment.
  • Half time program (starting at 235â‚¬/month) with an access 20 half-days (or 10 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Quarter time program (starting at 145â‚¬/month) with an access 10 half-days (or 5 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Full time company program (starting at 500â‚¬/month) with unlimited access and more.

Startups have free Internet, printer, an access to 9 meeting rooms, a 220mÂ² terrace, a kitchen/sleep room, training sessions, an access to meeting-space for your public events and of course, national professionals from La Rucheâ€™s network.

Le + : As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in La Ruche can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation AmorÃ§age funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance Ãle de France.

ğŸŒ Contact ğŸŒ
La RucheÂ® Paris
24 Rue de lâ€™Est
75020 Paris
paris@la-ruche.net
+33 (0)1 83 64 59 04
entry.summary: La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different â€œhivesâ€.

entry.title: NUMA
entry.content:
Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMAâ€™s philosophy.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ Incubator Name NUMA
ğŸŒ Location Paris, France
ğŸ”¢ Startups incubated 300
ğŸ› The â€œPetit plusâ€ NUMA offers a free open-space with bar on the ground floor
ğŸ’µ Price Free co-working space
Privatization of rooms from 1200â‚¬/day

It all started in 2000 with Silicon Sentier, an entrepreneur association with more than 180 partner companies. Their initial objective was to encourage meetings between entrepreneurs and to allow new projects to emerge and floor on the Next Big Thing. The idea was to design a network capable of promoting and facilitating the development of entrepreneurship at the national level, and thatâ€™s what became NUMA today.

NUMA is not only an open space for entrepreneurs or small businesses today, itâ€™s a hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups - with a presence in Paris, Barcelona, Mexico, Toulouse, Berlin and even New York.

Not only an open-space

The first time I went to NUMA, it was just to have a place where to discuss professionally with other students, entrepreneurs and business leaders, I also discovered a free space co-working on the ground floor, with possibility to rent different rooms for private meetings.

But my biggest surprise was to discover the â€œformationsâ€. Today, the challenge is not only to master the technical aspect of a project but also the notions of management, intrapreneurship, design thinking and digital marketing. And guess what? Thatâ€™s exactly what NUMA offers. In fact, we understand quickly that we do not invest only in a HQ or a place to work, but in a long-term support of your project.

â€œTo infinity and beyondâ€

Regarding the incubation program, NUMA brings its expertise to startups already on the market and having a consequent turnover, for 3.5 % equity participation. NUMAâ€™s philosophy is based on the development of the startupsâ€™ business and network, the implementation of a rigorous and effective methodology for executing their strategy as well as long-term support through a mentoring system with experts.

Looking for something fun to do there, to discover the atmosphere of NUMA ? Do not hesitate to visit â€œLa Cantineâ€, the first collaborative workspace created in Ãle-de-France Region, where many celebrities have passed to make conferences and exchange with members, like Mark Zuckerberg.

ğŸŒ Contact ğŸŒ
NUMA Paris
39 Rue du Caire
75002 Paris
+33 (0)1 40 13 64 40
entry.summary: Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMAâ€™s philosophy.

entry.title: PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27
entry.content:
With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ Incubator Name PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27
ğŸŒ Location Paris, France
ğŸ° Size 3500 m2 of offices, 100 m2 of common areas
+ gym room, relaxation area, â€¦
ğŸ”¢ Startups incubated 100
ğŸ› The â€œPetit plusâ€ PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 is labeled â€œParis Innovationâ€ by the City of Paris
+ Access to the â€œPIAâ€ (Paris Innovation AmorÃ§age) funding program
ğŸ’µ Price Starting at 250â‚¬/month

Whatâ€™s more inspiring than a natural-looking greenhouse with an important infrastructure and quality accommodation, all in the heart of Paris ? Powered by the Paris Innovation label, PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 is the ultimate friendly incubator with nearly 4 million euros raised by only 8 startups of the incubator.

In this friendly ecosystem, you have the choice between open or closed offices according to your needs, with a large common area free co-working, a waiting room, 9 meeting rooms fully equipped and relaxation areas (gym, patio). The team is composed of only 10 people with always a presence in the HQ.

An accompanying offer

Providing to startups an offer of hosting to work is something great, but an incubator would not be an incubator if it did not offer a continuous support. Thus, PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 offers business workshops, networking meetings, conferences, networking with experts in your field, as well as an access to a social platform bringing together all incubated startups.

PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 offers 3 programs for startups. Offices open starting at 560â‚¬/month (+ fees) or private (starting at 680â‚¬/month + fees) with the possibility of joining the Associate Program, allowing you to get :

  • A postal address at 27 rue du Chemin Vert (Paris 75011) with the management of your receptions and mailings stamped.
  • A permanent access badge to the premises (24h/24 and 7/7)
  • An access to the meeting rooms for the reception of your customers (according to availability)
  • A permanent access to the gym room
  • An access to the cafeteria
  • A profile of your company on the PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27â€™s intranet (news feed, events, meeting rooms booking, chat, â€¦)

Certified Paris Innovation by the City of Paris

As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation AmorÃ§age funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance Ãle de France.

To learn more about PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27, the reception is open from 9am to 6:30pm, if you want to have a preview of the atmosphere and the place, donâ€™t hesitate to go there. Itâ€™s only 5 minutes from the Place de la Bastille !

ğŸŒ Contact ğŸŒ
PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27
27 Rue du chemin vert
75013 Paris
+33 (0)1 75 77 87 00
contact@pepiniere27.fr
entry.summary: With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, PÃ©piniÃ¨re 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

entry.title: Ecole 42
entry.content:
Ã‰cole 42 is a French institution specialised in free and open courses without any prerequisites. During 2 to 5 years, the school trains hundreds of developers by proposing the â€œself-studyâ€ learning method through dozens of projects and programming rushs (called â€œpoolsâ€).

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ School Name Ã‰cole 42, 42 School or 42
ğŸŒ Location Paris, France
âš–ï¸ Type Self-study institution / Association
ğŸ“† Course Duration 2 to 5 years
ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Erasmus Students Accepted
ğŸ’µ Price Free

Created in 2013 by Xavier Niel (CEO Free & Iliad Group) and Nicolas Sadirac (ex-Director Epitech), Ã‰cole 42 is a French Computer Science institution that prepares students for the computer and code development professions. By training young people from all horizons, Ã‰cole 42 intends to highlight the capacity of innovation and digital transformation of companies in France and around the world.

At Ã‰cole 42, there is no course and no teachers, it is only learning peer-to-peer (or self-study). There are no notes and everyone progresses at their own pace through dozens of projects (team or alone) as well as many programming rushes (inspired by the EPITA and Epitech â€œpoolâ€).

â€œBorn to codeâ€

To join Ã‰cole 42, no prerequisites are needed but only a period of programming rush, called the â€œPiscineâ€ (or pool) : It is an immersion in the world of coding, used to identify the most motivated students. During 1 month, you will be able to discover the different aspects of the school and its method of learning. Best thing ? You can sleep for free in the school during this period. 2 weeks after the end of the pool, you will receive your results telling you if you can join the school or not.

If you succeed, the training will last from 2 to 5 years according to your choice of studies. The program at Ã‰cole 42 is divided into 2 main parts : the compulsory notions to be acquired for a permanent job as a developer, such as network or algorithmic, followed by a phase of improvement during which the student can discover the many facets of development (Security, Artificial Intelligence, Deep learning, AR/VR, â€¦).

At the end of your studies, Ã‰cole 42 does not give a state-recognised degree, as the school is not officially considered as school but more as a non-profit association. However, the expertise of developers from 42 is now recognised in many companies around the world.

A campus open all the time

The French campus of Ã‰cole 42 is located in the north of Paris, in a recent and well-equipped building. You will find dormitories, a canteen, food trucks, gaming areas, conference rooms and many machine rooms with computers (running macOS). The school currently has 9 clubs, including air-soft, training and sale of business services.

A few months ago, 42 France announced the expansion of the initial campus with the initiative â€œNot A Campusâ€ (NOC). This new campus will include club space, open-spaces, a collaborative grocery store, a fitness room, a student residence, green spaces and gardens (open to everyone).

Nota Bene : Due to growing interest of the Ã‰cole 42â€™s method around the world, the school opened a second campus few years ago, in the Silicon Valley (Fremont, CA). The philosophy is the same and if you are interested in the American campus, donâ€™t hesitate to visit their website 42.us.org.

ğŸŒ International Relation Service ğŸŒ
42 France does not offer specific contact, but I invite you to visit the admissions website : candidature.42.fr
entry.summary: Ã‰cole 42 is a French institution specialised in free and open courses without any prerequisites. During 2 to 5 years, the school trains hundreds of developers by proposing the â€œself-studyâ€ learning method through dozens of projects and programming rushs (called â€œpoolsâ€).

entry.title: Efrei
entry.content:
Located only 15 minutes from Paris, Efrei is a general engineering school of digital technologies founded almost 90 years ago. Efrei delivers a French engineering degree since 1957 and offers French and English courses to foreign students.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ School Name Ã‰cole dâ€™ingÃ©nieur gÃ©nÃ©raliste en informatique et technologies du numÃ©rique (Efrei Paris)
ğŸŒ Location Villejuif, France
âš–ï¸ Type Private Engineering School
ğŸ“† Course Duration 3 to 5 years
ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Erasmus Students Accepted
ğŸ’µ Price 9200â‚¬/year (students from Europe and Africa)
10900â‚¬/year (other students)

Located in a small town near Paris in a cozy campus, Efrei is a private engineering school specialized in digital technologies, with different programs for international students. The school was founded almost 90 years ago and merged 2 years ago with Esigetel (another engineering school) to become Efrei Paris.

Digital tech at the center of education

When we talk about new technologies, most of us think about computer science or IT, but Efrei offers a teaching around digital technologies. Thanks to that, students build their own personalized program : they have the choice between 4 integrated â€œclasses prÃ©paratoiresâ€ and 12 majors covering all digital domains (including 6 in full English, see below).

For international students, Efrei offers a Master of Engineering (or DiplÃ´me dâ€™ingÃ©nieur in French), including 3 years of undergraduate education and 2 years at the graduate level.

Efreiâ€™s undergraduate program is composed of scientific and technical engineering courses that are both general, such as mathematics, electronics, computer science or physics. It is a great way to prepare future engineers for their future responsibilities in the professional world.

After this period, students develop and refine their career goals, making them job-ready thanks to different majors, and some of them are completely in English, like : software engineering, finance, big data, business, networks and cloud IT. If you feel comfortable with French, you can also orient yourself in AR/VR, droids, drones, avionics, space, or even renewable energies.

We are committed to training engineers conscious of others and open to the world, combining technical expertise and interpersonal know-how as innovators or entrepreneurs. In order to achieve this result, we are constantly striving to innovate, in a dynamic of digital and pedagogical transformation.
Philippe Volle, Dean of Studies and Research

A cozy campus

The campus is nice and well placed, you have public transport to reach Paris and other schools nearby as EPITA, Supâ€™Biotech or Epitech. You will find less expensive accommodation in Villejuif or Kremlin-BicÃªtre than in Paris. Le + : The Val-de-Marne department offers a refund of part of your transport costs.

Student life is also active in Efrei campus, with around 50 different clubs, like photography, movies, 3D modeling, aviation, gaming and international (do not hesitate to contact EFREI Intâ€™, which welcomes foreign students in the school).

ğŸŒ International Relation Service ğŸŒ
Christiane Michel
Director of International Relations
Head of Language Department
christiane.michel@efrei.fr
entry.summary: Located only 15 minutes from Paris, Efrei is a general engineering school of digital technologies founded almost 90 years ago. Efrei delivers a French engineering degree since 1957 and offers French and English courses to foreign students.

entry.title: EPITA
entry.content:
Specialised in Computer Science and Engineering since 1984, EPITA is a private French engineering school located a few minutes from Paris, which offers several degree programs in English for international students, from Bachelor to Master.

The Info Box Â 
ğŸ¢ School Name Ã‰cole pour lâ€™Informatique et les Techniques AvancÃ©es (EPITA)
ğŸŒ Location Kremlin-BicÃªtre, France
âš–ï¸ Type Private Engineering School
ğŸ“† Course Duration 18 months to 3 years
ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Erasmus Students Accepted
ğŸ’µ Price â‰ˆ 9000â‚¬/year + fees

Created in 1984, EPITA (School for Computer Science and Advanced Techniques) is an engineering school located in Ãle-de-France Region, specialised in Computer Science. The school offers various degree programs for international students, which can mingle with French students (of which I am a member) on the main campus located in Kremlin-BicÃªtre, just a few minutes from Paris.

Main campus is made up of different buildings and many rooms with computers of last generations (Linux and macOS). Campus is shared with another school, Epitech, a computer school that offers IT degree. I invite you also to read Epitechâ€™s presentation.

EPITA offers 4 degree programs for international students : a Bachelor of Computer Science (BCS), two Masters of Science (in Computer Science and AI Systems) and a Master of Computer Engineering. In addition to these courses, EPITA also offers bootcamps and entrepreneurship short programs and joint & dual degrees.

A wide range of specialization

During your studies, you will be able to choose majors, such as Global IT Management, Software Development, Project management, Advanced Algorithms, IOT, Networks & Security and more. You will also attend general courses in the early years, such as algorithmics, linear algebra, thermodynamic physics, computer architecture and electronics.

EPITA is a school that allows everyone to discover computing through workshops and multiple projects. Every student can find or discover a new passion, whether itâ€™s about security or project management.
â€“ Samy Hussaein, EPITA 4th year Student

A very active student life

The Student Life is very active in the main campus, with more than 70 clubs and organizations, like video games, programming, movies club and more. Only a few minutes from public transport, you can easily reach the center of Paris and nice places. Le + : The Val-de-Marne department offers a refund of part of your transport costs.

Finally, as a part of your final semester, you will have to do an internship. Paris and surrounding cities host many startups and large companies, like Apple, Google, Microsoft and Facebook. The French Tech is also a great way to discover new French startups with great potential, like in the incubator Station F, just ten minutes from the EPITA campus.

ğŸŒ International Relation Service ğŸŒ
Rabih HADDAD
Director of International Programs
rabih.haddad@epita.fr
+33 (0)1 80 51 71 37
entry.summary: Specialised in Computer Science and Engineering since 1984, EPITA is a private French engineering school located a few minutes from Paris, which offers several degree programs in English for international students, from Bachelor to Master.
